# More about me

Add a map using `leaflet` with a marker on my hometown.
Perhaps also on Dublin for my PhD, and on Oxford where I am now.

```{r, fig.width=8, fig.height=5, results='asis', warning=FALSE, fig.align='center'}
strasbourg <- world.cities %>% 
  filter(name == "Strasbourg" & country.etc == "France") %>% 
  mutate(info = "Where I'm from")
dublin <- world.cities %>% 
  filter(name == "Dublin" & country.etc == "Ireland") %>% 
  mutate(info = "Where I received my Ph.D.")
oxford <- world.cities %>% 
  filter(name == "Oxford" & country.etc == "UK") %>% 
  mutate(info = "Where I work now")
markers <- bind_rows(
  strasbourg,
  dublin,
  oxford
) %>% mutate(
  label = sprintf("<b>%s (%s)</b><br/>%s", name, country.etc, info)
)
leaflet(options = leafletOptions(maxZoom = 4)) %>%
  addProviderTiles("Stamen.Watercolor") %>%
  # addProviderTiles("Stamen.TonerHybrid") %>% 
  addMarkers(~long, ~lat,
    label = ~as.character(label), data = markers) %>% 
  addLabelOnlyMarkers(~long, ~lat, label = ~as.character(label), data = markers,
    labelOptions = labelOptions(noHide = TRUE, direction = 'left', textOnly = TRUE))
```
